purpleculture_pinyin:
zhèng
to struggle to get free; to strive to acquire; to make (money)
бороться за освобождение; стремиться к приобретению; зарабатывать деньги)

zhēng
see 挣扎
см. 挣扎
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 挣)
Ideographic: To fight 爭 by hand 扌; 爭 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
掙錢 [ zhèng qián ]: to make money
掙脫 [ zhèng tuō ]: to throw off; to struggle free of; Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
掙得 [ zhèng dé ]: to earn (income); to make (money)
掙扎 [ zhēng zhá ]: to struggle
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 爭 [ zhēng ] to dispute, to fight, to contend, to strive
heisig_chinese_memo: When in a struggle with another, people always use their fingers to fight or contend.
Ru_trainchinese:
zhèng: (глаг) зарабатывать, получать; бороться за свою свободу
zhēng: (графема) бороться (используется только в 挣扎)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: At the end of the day basketball is just fingers contending with each other in a struggle to get that ball in the hoop.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " hand " to the sound of " competition ". Indicates strong support. For example, Shi Naian's "Water Margin" Chapter 8 of the Yuan Dynasty: "Lin Chong got up and was hindered by the shackles, and he couldn't bend." Chapter 3 of Wu Jingzi's "The Scholars of the Scholars" in the Qing Dynasty: "(Fan Jin) walked out the door Not much time, I kicked it in the pond, and got up, my hair fell apart, my hands were yellow mud, dripping with water."

" Earn " also means to get rid of hard. For example, Wu Chengen's "Journey to the West" Chapter 46 of the Ming Dynasty: "The walker is anxious, twists his fist, earns a profit, and breaks the rope." Qing Dynasty Wenkang "Children Heroes" Chapter 31: "Thieves But there was no one who yelled to save people; he earned two, never made any move, so he hit a whistle in his mouth to whistle the two thieves of the wind."

" Earn " means to obtain and earn. Such as Ma Zhiyuan's "Han Gong Qiu. "Wedge": "My ancestor Gao emperor, Fenbuyi, rises abundantly, peculiarly, destroys the Qin Tuxiang, earns this foundation." Feng Menglong of the Ming Dynasty "Awakening the World Hengyan." "The oil seller monopolizes the oiran": "In less than a year, the family business has been earned like a beautiful flower, driving slaves and maids, and it is very atmospheric."

" Earn " means modification. Such as Dong Jieyuan in the Jin Dynasty, "The Tune of the West Chamber". Volume Three: "Take a mirror from the comb and the box to make your face shine." The second booklet of the second book "The Story of the West Chamber" by Wang Shifu in Yuan Dynasty: "Work hard and earn a lot of money on the forehead."

" Earn " is used with " support ", such as the first fold of the anonymized "Chenzhou Dunmi" in Yuan Dynasty: "You earn your pockets, can I measure with you." Li Shizhen, Ming Dynasty, "Compendium of Materia Medica. Food Department. "Bitter Hu": "When you have this disease, pull your eyelids up and down with your hands to fix the pot Lukong.
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand " to the sound of " competition ". "To earn " means to support and get rid of.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「爭」聲。表示用力支撐。如元代施耐庵《水滸全傳》第8回：「林沖掙的起來，被枷礙了，曲身不得。」清代吳敬梓《儒林外史》第3回：「（范進）走出大門不多路，一腳踹在塘裏，掙起來，頭髮都跌散了，兩手黃泥，淋淋漓漓一身的水。」

　　「掙」也表示用力擺脫。如明代吳承恩《西遊記》第46回：「行者心焦，捻著拳，掙了一掙，將綑的繩子就皆掙斷。」清代文康《兒女英雄傳》第31回：「作賊的可沒個嚷救人的；他掙了兩掙，不曾掙得動分毫，便嘴裏打了個哨子，哨那兩個把風的賊。」

　　「掙」表示獲取、賺取。如元代馬致遠《漢宮秋．楔子》：「俺祖高皇帝，奮布衣，起豐、沛，滅秦屠項，掙下這等基業。」明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．賣油郎獨占花魁》：「不上一年，把家業掙得花錦般相似，驅奴使婢，甚有氣象。」

　　「掙」表示修飾。如金代董解元《西廂記諸宮調．卷三》：「梳裏箱兒裏取明鏡，把臉兒掙得光瑩。」元代王實甫《西廂記》第二本第二折：「下工夫將額顱十分掙。」

　　「掙」用同「撐」，如元代佚名《陳州糶米》第一折：「你掙著口袋，我量與你麼。」明代李時珍《本草綱目．菜部．苦瓠》：「遇有此病，將眼皮上下用手掙開，將壺盧孔合定。」
humanum_short_description: 從「手」，「爭」聲。「掙」表示用力支撐、用力擺脫。

Ideographic: To fight 爭 by hand 扌; 爭 also provides the pronunciation
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 爭 [ zhēng ] to dispute, to fight, to contend, to strive
  • Pinyin: zhèng

    English Definition: to struggle to get free; to strive to acquire; to make (money)
    Example Words:
    掙錢 [ zhèng qián ]: to make money
    掙脫 [ zhèng tuō ]: to throw off; to struggle free of; Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
    掙得 [ zhèng dé ]: to earn (income); to make (money)
    More: 掙* | *掙 | *掙*
  • Pinyin: zhēng

    English Definition: see 挣扎
    Example Words:
    掙扎 [ zhēng zhá ]: to struggle
    More: 掙* | *掙 | *掙*

從「 手 」，「 爭 」聲。表示用力支撐。如元代施耐庵《水滸全傳》第8回：「林沖掙的起來，被枷礙了，曲身不得。」清代吳敬梓《儒林外史》第3回：「（范進）走出大門不多路，一腳踹在塘裏，掙起來，頭髮都跌散了，兩手黃泥，淋淋漓漓一身的水。」 「 掙 」也表示用力擺脫。如明代吳承恩《西遊記》第46回：「行者心焦，捻著拳，掙了一掙，將綑的繩子就皆掙斷。」清代文康《兒女英雄傳》第31回：「作賊的可沒個嚷救人的；他掙了兩掙，不曾掙得動分毫，便嘴裏打了個哨子，哨那兩個把風的賊。」 「 掙 」表示獲取、賺取。如元代馬致遠《漢宮秋．楔子》：「俺祖高皇帝，奮布衣，起豐、沛，滅秦屠項，掙下這等基業。」明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．賣油郎獨占花魁》：「不上一年，把家業掙得花錦般相似，驅奴使婢，甚有氣象。」 「 掙 」表示修飾。如金代董解元《西廂記諸宮調．卷三》：「梳裏箱兒裏取明鏡，把臉兒掙得光瑩。」元代王實甫《西廂記》第二本第二折：「下工夫將額顱十分掙。」 「 掙 」用同「 撐 」，如元代佚名《陳州糶米》第一折：「你掙著口袋，我量與你麼。」明代李時珍《本草綱目．菜部．苦瓠》：「遇有此病，將眼皮上下用手掙開，將壺盧孔合定。」

For example, Shi Naian's "Water Margin" Chapter 8 of the Yuan Dynasty: "Lin Chong got up and was hindered by the shackles, and he couldn't bend." Chapter 3 of Wu Jingzi's "The Scholars of the Scholars" in the Qing Dynasty: "(Fan Jin) walked out the door Not much time, I kicked it in the pond, and got up, my hair fell apart, my hands were yellow mud, dripping with water." " Earn" also means to get rid of hard. For example, Wu Chengen's "Journey to the West" Chapter 46 of the Ming Dynasty: "The walker is anxious, twists his fist, earns a profit, and breaks the rope." Qing Dynasty Wenkang "Children Heroes" Chapter 31: "Thieves But there was no one who yelled to save people; he earned two, never made any move, so he hit a whistle in his mouth to whistle the two thieves of the wind." Feng Menglong of the Ming Dynasty "Awakening the World Hengyan." 掙字的基本解释

掙
zhēng
同“挣”。

掙
zhèng
同“挣”。

掙字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhèng］
［《字彙》側迸切］
“掙1”的新字形。
(1)奋力摆脱；竭力支撑。
(2)出色；漂亮。
(3)打扮。
(4)撑开；胀。
(5)使劲用力于他物。
(6)挤。
(7)用力获取；赚取。
(8)发怔；发呆。
[②]［zhēng］
［《集韻》初耕切，平耕，初。］
“掙2”的新字形。
撞；击。
[③]［zhēng］
亦作“掙3”。
(1)用同“睁”。张开眼睛。
(2)用同“争”。参见“挣3氣”。

掙字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　掙； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页438第03
【集韻】初耕切，音鐺。【博雅】刺也。　又【字彙】側迸切，音諍。【中原雅音】掙，剉也。

掙字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形

暂无。

earn
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhèng］
[Side cut of "Words"]
The new glyph of "Earn 1".
(1) Strive to get rid of; Strive to support.
(2) Excellent; beautiful.
(3) Dress up.
(4) Spread; expand.
(5) Use hard work on other things.
(6) Squeeze.
(7) Obtain hard; earn.
(8) Frozen; in a daze.
[②]［zhēng］
["Ji Yun" first ploughing cut, flat ploughing, early. ]
The new glyph of "Earn 2".
Hit; hit.
[③] [zhēng]
Also called "Earn 3".
(1) Use the same as "open". Open your eyes.
(2) Use the same "competition". See "Earn 3 Qi".
earn
